TREATMENT FOR KIT NO. 4
"A ROLE FOR EVERYBODY (Selecting and Utilizing
the Television Lesson)
VIDEO
Transition in study guide to
the specific lesson for which
our example classroom is getting
ready. Seen long enough to
give clear idea of pre-telecast
activities. (Be sure to show
marginal notes covering points
teacher wants to be sure to
bring up. Be sure to show
indications of adapting the
study guide to this particular
locale's resources.)
Narrator's hand places on the
page of the study guide the
puzzle piece containing the
individual student. Should be
seen in conjunction with the
objectives of this specific
television lesson.
Transition to whole puzzle.
Narrator's hands are seen
fitting the student puzzle
piece, the television receiver
puzzle piece, and the study
guide puzzle piece into the
composite puzzle. He puts
the puzzle together and pushes
the pieces together to close
the crack of the question mark.
AUDIO
NARRATOR CALLS ATTENTION TO PRE¬
TELECAST ACTIVITIES. ALSO CALLS
ATTENTION TO TEACHER'S NOTES AND TO
THE FACT THAT THE TEACHER HAS
ADAPTED THE SUGGESTIONS IN THE
STUDY GUIDE TO THE RESOURCES WHICH
ARE AVAILABLE TO HER IN THIS PARTIC¬
ULAR LOCALE OR SITUATION.
NOW, SAYS THE NARRATOR, IN HER
PREPARATION FOR THE TELEVISION LES¬
SON TODAY , HAS THE TEACHER MADE
CLEAR TO THIS STUDENT WHAT HE IS
TO GET FROM THE TELEVISION LESSON?
DOES HE KNOW WHAT HE IS TO LOOK FOR..
TOWARD WHAT GOALS THIS LESSON IS
DIRECTED?
(NARRATOR) Only when every element
involved in this learning experience,
the student...the classroom teacher.,
those preparing the television lesson
are "all of a piece"...working
together in cooperation and clear
understanding toward shared goals...
can we say that proper preparation
has been made for teaching with
television in THIS classroom
